competencies.name: Assistant confirms that they have had the correct training to perform the role
Assistant follows driver’s instructions as to positioning during reversing
Assistant is aware of the size and location of the crush zone
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is the crush zone?
  2. In relation to the waste vehicle itself, at all times reversing assistants must be able to remain at least:-how many metres from the rear of the vehicle?
    3. -how many metres from the side of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Assistant checks that the reversing activity can be performed without entering the crush zone
Assistant is aware if the route/task risk assessment forbids the use of reversing assistants
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is a route risk assessment?
  2. Why is it important in relation to the reversing assistant’s role?

competencies.name: Assistant takes up a position which allows a full view of the rear of the vehicle
Assistant takes up a position which keeps the driver in clear view in the reversing mirror
Assistant gives a clear signal to the driver to stop if changing position or approaching the driver to give additional instruction or information
Assistant establishes visual contact with the driver before giving a clear signal to start the reversing process after it has been stopped
Assistant never walks backwards when acting as a reversing assistant
Assistant looks out for slip, trip and fall hazards when assisting the reversing process
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are the likely hazards to watch out for when acting as a reversing assistant?

competencies.name: Assistant ensures that pedestrians do not enter the crush zone
Assistant gives clear signal to the driver to stop if pedestrians enter the crush zone
Assistant uses correct stop and reverse signals to the driver in order to prevent collisions with third party vehicles or property
Assistant reports to driver and/or supervisor when it is unsafe to reverse in line with company procedure
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting when it is unsafe to reverse?

competencies.name: Assistant uses the correct hand signals and instructions throughout the reversing operation for:•Move towards guide•Move away from guide•Move to the right •Move to the left •Stop
Assistant makes signals which are clear, bold and consistent
Assistant uses correct high-visibility clothing and Personal Protective Equipment when giving reversing instructions
